dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 4295 IH: Protecting Airline Passengers from Sexual Assaults Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Norton introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To direct the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to collect and maintain data on the number of sexual assaults that occur on aircraft during flights in passenger air transportation, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Airline Passengers from Sexual Assaults Act of 2014.

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall establish a program to collect and maintain data on the number of sexual assaults that occur on aircraft during flights in passenger air transportation.
The Administrator shall make available to the public on the primary Internet Web site of the Federal Aviation Administration the data maintained under subsection (a).
In this section, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.text: The term air transportation has the meaning given that term in section 40102(a)(5) of title 49, United States Code, and includes intrastate air transportation.
The term aircraft has the meaning given that term in section 40102(a)(6) of title 49, United States Code.
The term intrastate air transportation has the meaning given that term in section 40102(a)(27) of title 49, United States Code.
